intro: Calyculogygas serrana, commonly known as the serrated calyculogyga, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, serrated leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
